Why's that?{NICKNAME} 'Cause without any evidence, the court'll probably reject your claim of self-defense, and they'll just rule that it was an intentional street fight.Paimon Okay, and then what?{NICKNAME} Well if that happens, you'll almost certainly end up having to duel before you're put to trial.{NICKNAME} At that point, you'll either have to fight the same person all over again, or go head-to-head with their Champion Duelist.Paimon ...Paimon just feels bad for whoever has to fight you

c36938c4e738132d.voiceContent: #Paimon What sort of slime do you like the most, {NICKNAME}?{NICKNAME} Cryo Slimes, I think. You feel cold just getting close to them — you'll need that sort of thing in summer.Paimon That's very practical, as expected of a traveler.{NICKNAME} What about you, Paimon?Paimon Paimon likes them all! They're all very tasty!{NICKNAME} Tasty, huh...Paimon Turning slimes into bubbly, lovely, jubbly meals is the Paimon Special!{NICKNAME} Well then...{NICKNAME} I suppose that's one more thing I can eat before you become emergency rations, huh, Paimon?Paimon Uhh... Paimon would rather not be on that list at all

c50279b6aa929064.voiceContent: #Paimon So, with Sumeru having so many scholars in different Darshans, do you think they end up arguing a lot?Paimon You know, just like the rivalry between Li cuisine and Yue cuisine in Liyue.{NICKNAME} I'm sure they do. Conflict between different schools of thought is the most normal thing ever. As the Liyue martial arts novels say Wherever there are people, there will be conflict.Paimon Wow, what a line. That's heavy... But the scholars in Sumeru probably don't duel like Liyue martial artists, right?{NICKNAME} Maybe they settle things with a game of Genius Invokation TCG.Paimon Ohh, good point! A duel of wits!Paimon Paimon can just imagine it When one scholar can't convince another in an argument, he takes out his deck of cards, calmly sits down opposite his opponent, thinks for a moment, and then secures his victory!{NICKNAME} That does sound like something that would happen in Sumeru.Paimon The game ends, and the winner says good game as a sign of respect to his opponent. After that, both sides are back on good terms.{NICKNAME} Umm, not necessarily...Paimon Huh? Why

c9ba37739d9d784e.voiceContent: #Paimon Have you ever had one of those super scary nightmares, {NICKNAME}?{NICKNAME} Um, I've dreamt of falling through endless darkness...{NICKNAME} Without a wind glider.Paimon Eek...{NICKNAME} I've also dreamt of my brother walking away from me, while I'm unable to catch up to him no matter how fast I run.{NICKNAME} ...He tells me that I've come too late.Paimon Oh...Paimon Yours are quite different from the ones that Paimon's had.Paimon Paimon's scariest dream was being eaten by a super giant slime

ca3e3b88d09381fa.voiceContent: #{NICKNAME} I've heard that if you give tavern owners a considerable tip, they'll be willing to share some information on the down low.Paimon You mean the Angel's Share? But Master Diluc seems like a very rich man.Paimon How big a tip is considerable, anyway?{NICKNAME} Huh... Maybe I might have heard wrong.{NICKNAME} Or, maybe I might have heard this rumor in another world...Paimon You sure have been to many worlds, haven't you

cdad7fe0b92fd30e.voiceContent: #{NICKNAME} I wonder where those treasure-chasing Seelie come from.Paimon Maybe they grow out of the ground — or maybe they fall from trees?Paimon Well, Paimon doesn't know where they come from, but where there are Seelie, treasure's not far away!{NICKNAME} *sigh* Still... why do I feel a certain sadness every time they touch those treasures?Paimon Hmm?{NICKNAME} ...No, it's probably just my imagination.Paimon Well... if you don't want the treasure, Paimon can hang onto it for you, free of charge

ce78940dd0469917.voiceContent: #Paimon How do you become as popular and cool as Captain Beidou?{NICKNAME} With enough experience...?Paimon Paimon's already seen lots of things from adventuring together with you!{NICKNAME} One also needs to experience trials and setbacks...Paimon Paimon almost drowned that one time...{NICKNAME} ...And maintain an inspirational disposition...Paimon Uh-huh! Paimon's always rooted for you!{NICKNAME} One must also have a... mature outlook towards problems.Paimon Hey! Are you just trying to say that Paimon can't make it

cf8b85f8eb6c127f.voiceContent: #{NICKNAME} The Meaty tribe, huh? These hilichurls pick the funniest names.Paimon The hilichurls of the Meaty tribe make regular sacrifices. The altars they build are really huge.{NICKNAME} What do they pray for?Paimon For meat to eat every day! It's an awesome wish, isn't it?{NICKNAME} ...I suppose I should have expected that answer

cf9a1da912415fda.voiceContent: #Paimon It's not only Sumeru locals at the Akademiya, huh. There are students from other nations too.Paimon Imagine leaving your hometown behind and traveling to a faraway and unfamiliar land in the pursuit of learning... How inspiring!{NICKNAME} We travel to unfamiliar lands pretty often, too.Paimon Huh, you're right! That means we're also super inspiring!{NICKNAME} Not in the pursuit of learning, though.Paimon Oh... So we're not as inspiring as the students after all...Paimon Buuut we do know the best places to eat in Sumeru, and who you can rely on to help you out! That counts as knowledge, right?{NICKNAME} Yeah, and to many people, it could be extremely valuable knowledge.Paimon Great, so we're just as inspiring as them after all

d0f83883a48de7a9.voiceContent: #Paimon Did you know the reeds in Dihua Marsh are common materials used in making paper?Paimon The solid reed cores are used to make pens, while the hollow part is used to make flutes. It's all very sophisticated.Paimon Over the years, many heroes and swordsmen have also chosen Dihua Marsh as the location of their duels.Paimon The more reeds, the more elegant the place. But in places where the reeds are the thickest, the water can be quite deep...Paimon So there are a lot of unlucky duelists who fall in and drown while the duel is on...{NICKNAME} Huh. And what's my takeaway from all of this supposed to be?Paimon Don't get into a fight in Dihua Marsh

d74c6902db349597.voiceContent: #Paimon Paimon's heard that even in Natlan, there are lots of ways to resolve conflict that don't involve contests of strength.{NICKNAME} Really? In the Nation of War?Paimon Yeah! Like, apparently, some people in the Children of Echoes settle their disputes by holding a dance-off!{NICKNAME} A dance-off? So, they mutually decide on a time and place...Paimon Uh-huh!{NICKNAME} And just dance their socks off?Paimon Mm-hmm!{NICKNAME} Until one person gets so exhausted, they can't get up anymore?Paimon Yep!Paimon ...Wait, what the... Hold on, that IS a contest of strength

d7a68ed7daf34cae.voiceContent: #{NICKNAME} In Hanamizaka, there's a place called the Bantan Sango Detective Agency.Paimon Paimon remembers. It's the one run by Sango and Ryuuji, right? Everyone speaks highly of them.{NICKNAME} Uh, I heard that they frequently get caught up in strange incidents, and some places have banned them from entering their premises...Paimon Paimon thinks that's undeserved. After all, Sango and Ryuuji have helped a lot of people...{NICKNAME} Would you invite them if you were organizing a dinner party?{NICKNAME} What if halfway through the meal, one of the guests suddenly shrieked and collapsed onto the ground...Paimon I—If that's the case, then Paimon thinks it's a bad idea. Paimon suddenly feels that hanging out with them could be dangerous...{NICKNAME} Well, that's the price you pay for being a famous detective

d7ba3b59b574ce0b.voiceContent: #Paimon Phew! Paimon's been working so hard recently. Any ideas on how to relax?{NICKNAME} Uhh... Sleeping?Paimon Sleeping's boring.{NICKNAME} Reading?Paimon Paimon'll get dizzy.{NICKNAME} ...Okay, having a chat with some friends?Paimon ...Ugh.Paimon But those're all things that require thinking.Paimon And not thinking is more relaxing.{NICKNAME} *sigh* And thus the Paimon Paradox, famed in the histories of philosophy in Teyvat, was put forth..

d93bc653dc44fe13.voiceContent: #Paimon It's a well-established tradition that during Inazuman celebrations everyone's wearing festive masks.Paimon Paimon tried to look around the stalls, but hasn't found any mask that fits...{NICKNAME} So you really want a mask of your own?Paimon Of course! Not wearing a mask during an Inazuman festival is the same as not receiving a bouquet at the Windblume Festival...{NICKNAME} Let me make one for you.Paimon Whoa! {NICKNAME}, you're the best!{NICKNAME} Hmmm, I wonder what kind of mask will fit you best? How about... a slime mask?Paimon Yay, Paimon Slime

d943d3f04ccddcfa.voiceContent: #Paimon Hey, so the valleys here are just bursting with shiny gemstones!Paimon This could be a huge opportunity for us! We should get digging ASAP. With any luck, we'll hit the jackpot and we'll never have to worry about Mora again!{NICKNAME} Hmm... But how would you actually know when you've hit the jackpot? Can you even tell which stones are the valuable ones?Paimon Uhh, well... Paimon just figured... the shinier the stone, the more valuable it is! Yeah, that should be about right!{NICKNAME} You're starting to sound like an evil fairytale dragon, hoarding all the shinies they can get their greedy claws on...Paimon Hehe, except we're in Natlan now — so instead of evil dragon, it's noble Saurian!Paimon O brave and cunning {NICKNAME}, follow this noble Saurian, for she shall lead you to the most precious gemstone in the entire world!{NICKNAME} Great! Except she can't tell which stones are the valuable ones, so how's that gonna work

da62bd573a581b34.voiceContent: #Paimon Did you know that there are all kinds of strange Shroom-Kin in Sumeru?{NICKNAME} Yup. Here's a fun one — legend has it that there were some forest boars who couldn't live without mushrooms, and the two species gradually formed a symbiotic relationship with each other. Now they're known as Shroomboars.Paimon Woah, that's a lot like us! Paimon can't live without {NICKNAME} either.{NICKNAME} If you can't live without me, that means... I'm the shroom, and Paimon's the...Paimon Boar!Paimon Hey, wait a second..

dbf849145c3f2201.voiceContent: #Paimon Kazuha is a free spirit, wouldn't you say?{NICKNAME} Yeah, he seems to be a bit of a loner too.Paimon Being able to explore the world at his leisure while savoring the beauty of everything around him. That doesn't sound too shabby...Paimon {NICKNAME}, you aren't thinking of sneaking off to go on a solo adventure, right?{NICKNAME} Aw, I would never leave you, Paimon.Paimon Paimon's really happy to hear that. Here... Hee—hee, have this...{NICKNAME} Monthly food expenses... 300,000 Mora!?Paimon Hey! Wait! {NICKNAME}, Where are you going?{NICKNAME} I suddenly feel like going solo. Maybe it's not a bad idea after all.Paimon Please don't go! Wait for Paimon

dd19cdd3a5247e98.voiceContent: #Paimon The Natlanese seem to do a lot of doodling everywhere. Except they don't call it doodling, do they? They call it, uh... flow-something?{NICKNAME} Phlogiston engraving. But strictly speaking, that refers to the engraving of special stone tablets. What you're talking about is just regular graffiti.{NICKNAME} Take this one, for example. It basically just says, You're in Nanatzcayan territory now! Children of Echoes for the win!Paimon That's pretty fun! Now Paimon wants in. Shall we do some graffiti of our own?{NICKNAME} We sure can. But what do you think we should draw?Paimon Well that's easy — a portrait of the best travel guide in all of Teyvat! Now let's see... Ah, there! Put it right there on that cliff face.{NICKNAME} So you want me to do the honors, huh? Alright then, lemme think about this... Yep, first we need to capture that classic Paimon facial expression seething with rage...Paimon Mhm-hmm— Wait, what!? Grr... You know what, forget it! Paimon has decided to find a professional Natlanese graffiti artist instead

de4750e3adbd79a9.voiceContent: #Paimon We should get something tasty to eat! Uh, but Paimon doesn't wanna have to go get it...{NICKNAME} Hmm, shall we decide with a game of rock-paper-scissors, then?Paimon Ooh, okay!{NICKNAME} Great! Alright, ready? Rock, paper—Paimon —Super Paimon Tornado!{NICKNAME} ...What

de67012d1ed5d0ee.voiceContent: #Paimon Khedive and Anisa kept talking about Purbiruni this and Pursina that...Paimon Why do all these words have pur at the front?{NICKNAME} Pur means descendant, and also student... So in this case, they're referring to themselves as the children and students of the great sages of old.Paimon Huh, so that's what it means... From the way they were throwing these words around, Paimon was sure it'd be something to be proud of.{NICKNAME} Wait... But isn't it?Paimon Well, Paimon for one would much rather be known as the founding father than have a name that basically says So-and-so's my daddy. Pretty embarrassing, don't you think?{NICKNAME} Um... Yeah, I have to admit, I've never thought about it like that..

dfd54ec0f1d85987.voiceContent: #Paimon The people and saurians of Natlan have a great relationship, huh? They live together, fight together, even fly together...{NICKNAME} Just like us, right? Except you're too small to take me flying... It's just a shame you can't grow any bigger. Not for want of trying, of course — you do eat a lot of Chicken-Mushroom Skewers...Paimon Hmph... Let's not forget that saurians can't be your guide. Or your conversation partner.{NICKNAME} It's strange to think that there was once a time when humans and saurians were enemies. And now they co-exist peacefully. Must've taken a lot of work to get to where things are today.Paimon If Paimon was a saurian, all it would have taken is some tasty food.{NICKNAME} You say that, but... what if you demanded a hundred chicken skewers per day, and the humans couldn't provide that much?Paimon Umm... Paimon could probably settle for fifty a day...{NICKNAME} Or even better — maybe the humans could team up with you and you could go hunting together. Then there'd be enough meat for everyone to eat their fill!Paimon Uh-huh! Peace between species all starts with a full stomach

e0401a54b618057f.voiceContent: #Paimon All these Sumeru scholars seem to wear Akasha Terminals so they can get information from the Akasha system.Paimon It's like they're carrying an interactive encyclopedia with them wherever they go. Paimon's kinda jealous.{NICKNAME} Well, I'm not jealous. I have an even better encyclopedia that automatically follows me around, gives me the A-to-Z on everything in Teyvat, and the best part is, it can even talk!Paimon Huh? Was that a compliment? Aw, you're making Paimon blush... Paimon definitely doesn't know as much as an encyclopedia! A-to-Y at most.{NICKNAME} Well, you know... maybe if you ate a little less, you'd have room for Z, too.Paimon Hey!!

e5b0cdd66e92f77c.voiceContent: #Paimon So apparently, some detectives in Fontaine manage to solve cases without ever setting foot outside their homes. They call them armchair detectives...Paimon That's what they call working from home, right? Sounds pretty cushy.Paimon Still, how do they figure out the truth if they never even go to the crime scene? ...Oh, Paimon knows! They must be using divination.{NICKNAME} You're thinking of fortune-tellers, Paimon. Not detectives.Paimon Oh... yeah...{NICKNAME} In any case, surely the evidence isn't just dropping itself off at the detective's doorstep.Paimon You mean... Oh, the detective must have people collecting information for them...{NICKNAME} Perhaps, or... Maybe they post commissions at the Adventurers' Guild?Paimon Huh? But... that would mean the detective gets all the credit for our hard work! Bet they make a tidy sum of Mora off of it, too! Hmph, Paimon won't stand for that. Let's go have a little talk with Detective Armchair right now

e659352bd4e72695.voiceContent: #{NICKNAME} I've heard that Albert, being the leader of Barbara's fan club...{NICKNAME} ...Sometimes gets bumps and bruises on purpose so that he can go to the Cathedral to see her.Paimon Paimon feels the Knights of Favonius should keep a closer watch on weirdos like that.{NICKNAME} But it seems that a month later, Albert discovered that Bennett was managing to see Barbara far more than he was.{NICKNAME} On second thought, Bennett does have the natural advantage when it comes to getting injured.Paimon What is this, a let's bother Barbara contest

e72fb571ccf89994.voiceContent: #Paimon Klee's a really interesting kid.Paimon All the Knights seem to like her a lot, too. You could even say they spoil her.{NICKNAME} I wonder, who makes the better mascot Paimon, or Klee?{NICKNAME} Oh wait, I forgot. Paimon's not a mascot, Paimon is emergency—Paimon Hey! Paimon knows exactly what you're going to say. That joke stopped being funny a long time ago

e7365ba3a3c4fa83.voiceContent: #Paimon Paimon wonders what the previous Shogun was like.{NICKNAME} It appears that she was a person who understood the fleeting nature of things, and accepted the inevitable fate of departing this world one day.Paimon After all, realizing the fragility of things in front of you makes you treasure them even more.{NICKNAME} This way of thinking must've influenced Inazuma's aesthetics. This world is transient, people come and go. The fun times we shared, our companionship, and the delicious foods we got to savor — those emotions and experiences are real things that existed at some point in time, not just empty concepts.Paimon Even though... Even though every banquet must eventually come to an end, it'd be nice to enjoy those happy moments for a little longer.{NICKNAME} Shifting seasons and elusive dreams, the ephemeral and fleeting, with thine companionship, all are eternal.Paimon Paimon doesn't get it!{NICKNAME} I'm saying that I'm having a lot of fun traveling with you, Paimon. It'd be nice if we could just go on like this forever.Paimon Paimon'll take your word for it then

e7531cf3b13d269e.voiceContent: #{NICKNAME} Speaking of Fischl, she also claims to be a visitor from another world...{NICKNAME} We're similar in that way. We even bring a pet along with us.Paimon Pet? Now, wait just a minute, here...{NICKNAME} But her raven, Oz... He looks cool, and is polite to boot.{NICKNAME} More importantly, he can both scout and fight — very useful indeed.{NICKNAME} Maybe I should make arrangements with Fischl to trade companions once in a while for, say, a week or two at a time? Hehe, it should be quite interesting.Paimon Hey! Doesn't Paimon get a say in this!

e9081d1a87db9584.voiceContent: #{NICKNAME} Everyone says that Mondstadt is the land of the wind.{NICKNAME} But, I wonder which direction the seasonal winds come from.Paimon Why don't we ask Venti?{NICKNAME} He'll probably just dodge the question with a hehe or something...Paimon True. The Anemo Archon is just a Tone-Deaf Bard. What does he know about the wind

e9fb136b0f104a7b.voiceContent: #{NICKNAME} If one hilichurl could beat, say, three wild boars...{NICKNAME} Then how many hilichurls would it take to reach the fighting prowess of Master Jean and Master Diluc?Paimon Not sure... but if you heard the way everyone talks in Mondstadt, you'd know that Master Jean is the strongest.{NICKNAME} I'd say that if Diluc strikes first, Master Jean wouldn't be able to counter.Paimon Oh, she'd find a way.{NICKNAME} There's no way.Paimon Master Jean's Elemental Burst is really strong, you know~{NICKNAME} Yes, but that field would also make Diluc stronger.Paimon Paimon doesn't think Master Jean would even need her Vision to take on Master Diluc, because—{NICKNAME} Diluc would only need a beginner's greatsword to—Paimon Argh...{NICKNAME} Ugh...{NICKNAME} *sigh* This... is so dumb.{NICKNAME} They both fight for Mondstadt, so they wouldn't come to blows.Paimon That's why Paimon likes your idea of measuring their fighting strength in number of hilichurls.Paimon ...Or in Paimon's case, in fifths of a wild boar

eac420416b104004.voiceContent: #Paimon The blossoms drifting down from the Sacred Sakura are so dazzling!Paimon Paimon heard that those flower petals can stay suspended in the air for so long because of being infused with Electro.{NICKNAME} Is it the same principle behind your levitation abilities?Paimon Uh... Ah... That's because...{NICKNAME} You do know what allows you to fly, don't you, Paimon?Paimon Paimon can fly because of... mysterious powers, obviously!{NICKNAME} Got it. Seems like you have no idea.{NICKNAME} How about we let Albedo do some research? He's good at cracking such mysteries...Paimon Please don't

ebfacc8364f176a2.voiceContent: #Paimon People in Sumeru seem to take divination and fortune-telling pretty seriously.Paimon For starters, there's astrology, although only the scholars get to practice that. But ordinary citizens have their ways, too. They can do divinations with just a cup of coffee!{NICKNAME} It's the nation of wisdom after all. It seems like people have an insatiable curiosity to learn about everything, including their own future.Paimon Paimon heard that they can tell your fate just by looking at the bottom of a finished cup of coffee...Paimon Sounds way easier than climbing to the top of a tower and staring at the stars all night!{NICKNAME} Oh, so you're interested in learning your fate now?Paimon Yeah... although, Paimon's really more interested in finding out what the coffee tastes like

eca8651bd4a6c2fd.voiceContent: #Paimon You learn new things so quickly.Paimon You've already got such a good grasp of Teyvat's language.{NICKNAME} You're a good teacher, Paimon.Paimon Aww, hehehe...{NICKNAME} Who knows, maybe the quality of your nasty nicknames will improve someday

ecace0597093fa16.voiceContent: #Paimon *sigh* Ogura Mio says that she hardly has any fancy kimonos in stock these days. So, chances are that you won't be able to buy one, even if you can afford it.Paimon It's a real tragedy... Paimon wants to look glamorous, too.{NICKNAME} But the Sakoku Decree's been abolished... She should be able to import silk from Liyue now.Paimon *gasp* You're right! Great, so there's hope for Paimon's kimono-dream after all!Paimon Just imagine it... Paimon emerges from Ogura's shop wearing a custom-made pure-silk one-of-a-kind kimono. Total transformation! This Paimon's going places!Paimon No longer just a sidekick in the legendary Traveler's adventure story... Oh no, say hello to Paimon the Elegant, wearer of fine silks and fated friend of heroes!Paimon Ahhh... Wouldn't that be amazing?Paimon ...It would, wouldn't it, {NICKNAME}? Um, so—{NICKNAME} What I'm hearing is... you want me to pay for your new wardrobe.Paimon Exactly, you read Paimon's mind! See, that's what being fated friends is all about!Paimon Um, so Paimon was thinking seven different styles, one for each day of the week. Still not sure on the specific designs though, let Paimon think...{NICKNAME} ...Uh, suddenly, I'm not so interested in buying

ecc32e060e651295.voiceContent: #Paimon Paimon's been dying to hear your thoughts about this... What is the deal with Ajaw? And don't say you haven't noticed.{NICKNAME} Noticed what?Paimon ...! Try everything! He's completely different from every other Saurian! For starters, he can talk — matter of fact, he never shuts up! Also, he's always hovering around Kinich instead of walking on the ground. Oh, and don't get Paimon started on those stupid sunglasses! Why would a Saurian wear sunglasses? It doesn't make any sense!{NICKNAME} Hmm...Paimon Why are you looking at Paimon like that...?{NICKNAME} It's just... You talk a lot too, and you fly, plus... didn't you get yourself a pair of silly-looking glasses in Fontaine?Paimon ...That is completely different!Paimon But anyway, there's a more glaring issue here... Ajaw is flat as a pancake! He's floating around looking like a little cardboard cutout, and no one in Natlan bats an eyelid! Don't you think that's strange?{NICKNAME} It's definitely unusual. Then again, maybe everyone's just used to it by now.{NICKNAME} Ultimately, it nobody's business but Ajaw's, so if you want answers, you'd probably have to ask him.Paimon But would he even tell us the truth? Paimon gets the feeling he'd just make up a bunch of phony-baloney to get us off his case...Paimon *gasp* Or maybe... He'd be like, Okay, if you really wanna know... I'll show you! And then poof! He'd turn us into cardboard cutouts too!{NICKNAME} Heh... Cardboard-cutout Paimon, now that I would love to see, hehehe...Paimon Hey... Cut it out! Paimon doesn't wanna be flat as a pancake..

ecdd9687047ed4f3.voiceContent: #Paimon People say that if you put a Starconch close to your ear, you can hear the whispers of the ocean!{NICKNAME} Do you want to give it a go, Paimon?Paimon No need, Paimon just heard it!{NICKNAME} Really? And what did the ocean say?Paimon The ocean said... that it's time to eat, so let's go! Paimon wants some Fisherman's Toast

ee65bc9d91be6f90.voiceContent: #Paimon Aoi gave Paimon a painting. Turns out it's not edible, but Paimon is still very happy with that gift!{NICKNAME} Aoi? The general goods shop owner? Let me see.Paimon Here, but be careful. It was painted by a famous artist, Utamarou. It's quite valuable!{NICKNAME} Utamarou? Hmm... I think I've heard that name before...Paimon Of course, master Utamarou's works can be found all around Inazuma after all!Paimon Did you see one of them in Ayaka's residence? The one that Paimon has right now isn't too shabby either.{NICKNAME} Oh, I remember now! One of those paintings was used by Yoimiya as kindling, right?Paimon Eh? Kindling?{NICKNAME} Uh, yeah! I think Thoma used it as padding for table legs as well.Paimon What? Padding?{NICKNAME} And, if I remember correctly, I also saw Sayu use a stack of those paintings as a cushion for her nap.Paimon Sayu has several of those works? That can't be right...{NICKNAME} Real masterpieces aren't mass-produced. If you ask me, that Utamarou isn't a real master at all.Paimon Hey

f0952631a99eacd4.voiceContent: #Paimon Five hundred... One thousand... One thousand two hundred...{NICKNAME} What are you up to, Paimon?Paimon Aaah! ...Sorry, you made Paimon jump...Paimon Hehe, Paimon was counting her Mora. She's been saving up a lot lately! In a few days time, she'll finally have enough to go buy a surfboard from the People of the Springs!Paimon Then, Paimon can zip and zoom along the Spiritways, just like Mualani!{NICKNAME} ...Spiritway surfing? You?Paimon Well, yeah... You don't sound very happy about it, what's wrong?{NICKNAME} I'm gonna miss you, that's all. I've enjoyed traveling with you... So many happy memories.Paimon Wait, what!? Stop making it sound like Paimon won't survive!Paimon Paimon's thought this through, y'know. Even if she falls off, it'll be fine — 'cause Paimon can fly!Paimon Mualani definitely has it harder in that sense... How does she even do it? The Spiritways get so steep and go so high, but she makes it look really easy.{NICKNAME} I don't think Mualani finds it hard at all, actually. You can tell by the big smile she has on her face even while performing highly complex maneuvers.Paimon Wait, so it's not hard, and Paimon's just... useless? ...That's worse

f1bd7248fe632939.voiceContent: #Paimon The Scions of the Canopy sure do love their extreme outdoor sports. Seems like they have a real appetite for danger.Paimon Free solo climbing, skysurfing, volcano parkour, bungee jumping off cliffs... Whew, even the thought of it makes Paimon light-headed!{NICKNAME} Really? Honestly, some of the stuff we've done is at least as dangerous as that... We froze half to death on Dragonspine, narrowly avoided being fried in all those thunderstorms, got sandblasted in the scorching desert, stared death in the face in those eerie Withering Zones... The list goes on.Paimon Huh, when you put it like that... Yeah, we've been through some pretty extreme stuff.{NICKNAME} Mhm, but we're built different. Most people's idea of danger is probably just an average day on the road for us. That's probably how it is for the Scions of the Canopy with their extreme sports as well.Paimon Whoa, wait a second! Let's get one thing straight YOU might be built different, but Paimon sure as heck isn't.Paimon Now, Paimon's sure you and your danger-braving buddies know what you're doing, but the second we find ourselves in serious trouble, Paimon's gonna... hide behind you until it's over

f2fb44f926b196b6.voiceContent: #Paimon Did you know? The people in Inazuma use the vibrations of Naku Weed to forecast thunderstorms.Paimon Because Naku Weed grows in areas that are infused with Electro, it's naturally drawn to thunder and lightning.{NICKNAME} Does that mean Naku Weed is similar to you, Paimon?Paimon Eh? How so?{NICKNAME} You know, because you usually hang out in areas infused with gourmet food and are naturally drawn to tasty snacks!Paimon Hee-hee, that's true!{NICKNAME} Paimon radar activated...Paimon *beep* Delicacies, here we go

f4319330aa9947b3.voiceContent: #{NICKNAME} Paimon, do you ever find that the word Aranara trips you up?Paimon Hmm? Why, does it trip you up? Maybe that's because you don't really say anything most of the time.Paimon Unlike Paimon! Paimon has to talk all the time, so she never gets stuck on words.{NICKNAME} Okay, well, try reading this then.Paimon What is it? Let's see here...Paimon Arana the Aranara exercises Ararakalari in the nearby area.Paimon Narana the Nara picks Padisarahs in a parallel area further afield.Paimon Narana the Padisarah-picking Nara had arranged to invite Arana the Aranara to the bar to befriend Lambad, but alas, Arana the Ararakalari-exercising Aranara professed a preference to Padisarah-picking Nara, Narana, for venturing to Vanarana to view the panorama.Paimon On account of Arana the Aranara's antipathy to bar drama, Narana the Nara relented and, upon accompanying the latter on a Vanarana-panorama adventure, encountered another Aranara, named Arama.Paimon This must be one of those really weird dreams, right...Paimon Ugh, but this headache feels pretty real..

f56cb10ca2a8f8cd.voiceContent: #Paimon Even though Naku Weed has a flower-like structure, its petals are in fact leaves.Paimon Its actual bloom is rather fragile, so the surrounding leaves try their hardest to grow strong and protect it...Paimon Hee-hee, just like Paimon is protecting you right now.{NICKNAME} Just like you? Oh, is Naku Weed edible too?Paimon Yeah, that's right! ...Wait? What are you trying to say

f582ea58f2451975.voiceContent: #Paimon The Steambird's head office is in Fontaine, right? Paimon wonders what stories make it into their newspapers.Paimon Do you think they reported on our adventures with Dvalin? Or our duel with the Raiden Shogun? Oh, and everything that happened at the Akademiya!{NICKNAME} I'm sure they cover just about everything that goes on. It's more a question of where it would appear — they probably have different sections reserved for different topics.Paimon Ooh, well in that case, we must make it onto the front page all the time! Surely that's where all the most exciting stories go.{NICKNAME} Hmm... I'm not so sure. We might've made front-page news once or twice, I guess. But I wouldn't be surprised if the headlines mostly focus on hit new operas or well-known actors.{NICKNAME} You know, stuff like, Actor X Spotted Drinking Coffee on Street, Actor Y Goes Public About New Relationship, or Actor Z to Retire From Performing.Paimon Why would they fill the best page with stuff like that? It's completely pointless.{NICKNAME} Well... trivial, maybe, but not pointless. Those are the stories that grab people's attention and convince them to buy the paper to get all the details.Paimon *sigh* ...Fine. Well... Maybe we'll be on the first few pages then? Surely, they've gotta put some real news in there. And it's gotta be interesting enough to keep people reading after they've gotten their dose of celebrity gossip. Right?{NICKNAME} The first few pages cover positive local news stories in the Court of Fontaine. Things like food and commodity prices going down, or progress updates on the aquabus expansions.{NICKNAME} They put these reports at the most prominent locations inside the newspaper. The point of them is mostly just to kill time.{NICKNAME} What goes on at the Akademiya might be important, but it doesn't directly impact the lives of people in Fontaine.Paimon Huh... So, where would they put our stories then?{NICKNAME} I'd guess on the very back page, after everything else.Paimon Aww... Why so far back!?{NICKNAME} I think they call it... saving the best till last.{NICKNAME} The editors probably embellish things a lot to flesh the story out, then break it into several chunks to make it into a series that runs over several days.Paimon Alright, so... what's the point of the final page, then?{NICKNAME} It gives the newspaper its raison d'etre.

f7e16c083f6bb75f.voiceContent: #Paimon The first time we saw the Wall of Samiel, Paimon was stunned... It seems to go on forever.{NICKNAME} Well, it was built to protect the entire rainforest, after all.Paimon And, it's so, so tall...Paimon Who knows if {NICKNAME}'ll be able to climb all the way to the top.{NICKNAME} I doubt it...? Also, why do I have to climb it, exactly?Paimon Uh... because it's right there?{NICKNAME} Hmm, even so... No.Paimon The Wall of Samiel is right there in front of us!{NICKNAME} I know, I know, but it's way too—Paimon But it's the Wall of Samiel...{NICKNAME} Fine! I'll go, okay

f89a31e4513552df.voiceContent: #Paimon Lavender Melons sure are useful!Paimon Their flesh can be eaten, and their skin can be processed to make dyes.{NICKNAME} Paimon sure is useful!{NICKNAME} She can serve as my guide, and she can also give other people ugly nicknames, haha.Paimon Yep! Thank you for your validation!Paimon Wait a minute, is there more? Is Paimon about to get roasted?Paimon Paimon's gonna cover your mouth to stop you from talking

fa95bac6b126e1c9.voiceContent: #Paimon Did you know, {NICKNAME}? That Sangonomiya Kokomi, she's Watatsumi Island's Divine Priestess.Paimon In other words, she's the ruler of Watatsumi Island! The whole of Watatsumi Island is controlled by her.Paimon Paimon also wants to become a big shot like her...{NICKNAME} What will you do after you become a big shot?Paimon Then, Paimon will deliver justice. For example... Ahem.Paimon The suspect in question, known as the Traveler, ate two Dango for lunch and only gave one to the victim, Paimon. This is a serious violation of article thirty seven, Fairness and Justice, of the Paimon Decree.{NICKNAME} Oh... may I ask how Your Excellency Paimon plans to resolve this issue?Paimon Of course. As compensation for your wrongdoings, you will have to make even more Dango for Paimon, hee-hee

fb4860335c140476.voiceContent: #Paimon {NICKNAME}, what do you think of treasure chests?{NICKNAME} I believe that they were left behind by great travelers who once passed this way.{NICKNAME} Every time I open one and look at its contents, I can feel a certain kinship with those who came before...Paimon And that's how you get adventure experience

fb78a0b1c05acb74.voiceContent: #Paimon Pretty crazy how things that happened only yesterday show up in today's issue of The Steambird...Paimon Even stuff that happened late at night way outside the city makes it in. How do they manage to get these articles written up so quickly?{NICKNAME} Yeah, not to mention printed first thing in the morning.Paimon Hehe, Paimon gets it! There must be a magic printer at The Steambird's office. As soon as the reporters bring in the latest news, they feed it to the printer, and it goes om-nom-nom-nom-nom, gobbling all the writing up ready to spit it back out when it's printing time!Paimon They probably have some reporters bursting in through the doors at the last minute, yelling WAIT! There's one last article to feed to the printer!{NICKNAME} That's definitely a very compelling image. But as far as I know, magic printers like that don't exist — it's all thanks to the tireless work of the editing team that The Steambird gets printed on time every day. They sit there going Huh? Hmph! Uhh... Oh no! as they race through correcting spelling errors, then they squeeeeeeeze it all into neat vertical columns of text, and run to their colleagues shouting Just give me five more minutes, please! That's the real magic behind meeting publishing deadlines.Paimon Whoa... It's pretty amazing that they're able to make a whole newspaper in just one day. Do they ever get time to sleep

fc5c5b9c526348e9.voiceContent: #Paimon Paimon will never forget the first saurians we saw in Natlan. They're just fascinating creatures.Paimon There was the Tepetlisaurs with their bouncy heads, the Koholasaurs with their smooth backs, and then the Yumkasaurs with their fluffy ears and heads.{NICKNAME} I bet a baby Yumkasaur would make the best teddy bear...Paimon Yeah... Hey, their fur probably keeps growing out as they get older, right? Do you think it starts getting in the way eventually?Paimon Like, imagine if a Yumkasaur had really long fur around the ears and head... they'd barely be able to see where they're going. And that could be kinda dangerous...{NICKNAME} You seem to have thought a lot about this. Are you planning on becoming a saurian hairstylist?Paimon Uh... Are you serious?{NICKNAME} Just think about it. Once you get famous, you'll be rolling in Mora!Paimon Oh... You're right! This is it, this is how Paimon makes her fortune!Paimon Paimon's gonna become the hairstylist for every Yumkasaur in Natlan! Hehehe, so much Mora...Paimon No, wait, the Mora's secondary! The best part of this plan is making friends with all the Yumkasaurs! Life will be sooo happy!{NICKNAME} But they're big, you know. It's gotta take a long time to style all that fur with just an ordinary pair of scissors. You might find you can only take one customer per day...{NICKNAME} If you're serious about this stylist business, you'd better start building some strength! At the very least, aim to lift a pair of scissors as big as the Dull Blade!Paimon The Dull Blade? But isn't that your weapon?{NICKNAME} Yeah, but I can let you borrow it for training. Come on! Let's get practicing!Paimon  Hey... This isn't training, this is give Paimon the sword and let her fight the monsters instead! Paimon did not sign up for this

fd56da1293dae514.voiceContent: Just what will we come across this time

fda888530575a9b2.voiceContent: #Paimon We've been passing by a lot of small shrines lately, but none of them seem to be dedicated to the Electro Archon.{NICKNAME} They were probably built for lesser deities. The people of Inazuma believe that everything around them has a spirit, and those spirits will help them in their time of need.Paimon Oh, so the people make shrines for them, and give them offerings.{NICKNAME} Yeah. In a way, it's a form of prayer and a token of appreciation.Paimon Paimon gets it now! Let's find Ayaka, and have her put up a shrine for us!Paimon If we do that, we'll be able to get lots of offerings as well!Paimon Paimon's so happy!{NICKNAME} Uh... I—Is that an acceptable thing to do?Paimon What's wrong? Haven't we been helping out everyone this whole time? We may be doing an even better job than those deities!{NICKNAME} You do have a point...{NICKNAME} But when I picture people placing flowers or fruits in front of a shrine for me... it doesn't feel right

ff2d2bac8e8722c3.voiceContent: #Paimon Fontaine's aquabuses are pretty cool. But imagine if they could run without tracks. Then you could go anywhere you want pretty much without having to move a muscle! Traveling would be way less tiring.{NICKNAME} But you already fly everywhere. Does that even get tiring?Paimon Fly... Fly? Wait, that's it! If we could find a way to make the boats float in the air, then they wouldn't need rails anymore. Hehe, and we could call them airboats!Paimon C'mon, let's go apply for one of those, uh... oh yeah — patents! We can't let Paimon's genius go to waste. Quick, before someone else beats us to it!{NICKNAME} Patents don't work like that... You can't just have a name for your invention. You also need to provide details of the original technical solution that makes your airboats float.Paimon Technical, huh? Hmm... Okay, got it! We just need to attach a giant propeller on top of the boats!{NICKNAME} Okay... But how would you prevent the boat from spinning along with the propeller? And how would you control the direction of movement?Paimon Um... Uh... Ugh. Paimon never realized flying was so complicated! It's always been second nature to Paimon...{NICKNAME} Hmm... Well, there might be an easier solution if we ditch the direction and speed control requirements?Paimon Huh? Really!?{NICKNAME} Yeah. It involves starting at a high altitude and flying downwards at a rapidly-increasing velocity.Paimon Hey! That isn't flying, that's free-falling
